summary: Primary fallopian tube cancer is a malignant neoplasm that originates from the fallopian tube. It is grouped under epithelial ovarian cancers and shares similarities and treatments with ovarian and primary peritoneal cancers.
symptoms: Pain in the abdomen or pelvis
Swelling in the abdomen or pelvis
Feeling of pressure in the abdomen or pelvis
Sudden or frequent urge to urinate
A lump in the pelvic area
diagnosis: Medical imaging (transvaginal ultrasound, abdominal ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)
Pathologic assessment of fallopian tissue (SEE-FIM Protocol)
Pelvic mass detection on routine gynecologic examination
treatments: Surgery (total abdominal hysterectomy, removal of ovaries, tubes, uterus, cervix, omentum removal, lymph node sampling)
